Network

Class Server.ClientManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • Network.Server.ClientManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    Server

    public class Server.ClientManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A ClientManager provides an easy way to hold a collection of Clients on the Server. Every Client has a ClientManager, which stores the Socket that they are connected to, the Player that they are using in the game, and a thread to receive and send messages.
    Author:
    Michael Hogue
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Server.ClientManager.GetThread
      A GetThread is exactly what it sounds like -- a Thread that has the sole purpose of trying to receive data until data is received.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Get the Player that this Client is playing in the World with.
        Returns:
        The ClientManager's Player

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String message,
         java.io.ObjectOutputStream o)
        The parse message is one of the most important methods on the Server. The parse method takes a string and attempts to understand what the Client is trying to do. If the first word is in the CommandList, we should process it. If it isn't in the CommandList, alert the Client that they must use an appropriate command. If it is in the CommandList, execute the Command that is associated with it's textual representation in the CommandList.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that needs to be parsed -- contains everything, including the command and all arguments.
        o - The OutputStream that we can use to communicate with the Client when we need to send them data.

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.Object message)
        Used to send data from the Server to the Client. Examples can be anything from their Player to update statistics, their Inventory to update the inventory panel, or a Note from another Player.
        Parameters:
        message - The Object that we are sending to the Client.
